meanings.definition: To make literal or represent in a literal sense.
meanings.sent1: She literalized the instructions by following them exactly.
meanings.sent2: He always literalized the stories he heard, missing the underlying meanings.
meanings.sent3: The robot literalized the joke, causing confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her mind literalized every word he said, unable to grasp metaphors.
meanings.sent5: The artist literalized her emotions on canvas, creating a vivid masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To interpret or understand in a strictly factual manner.
meanings.sent1: The scientist literalized the data, analyzing it without bias.
meanings.sent2: She literalized the historical events, focusing only on documented facts.
meanings.sent3: The child literalized the fairy tale, questioning the logic of magic.
meanings.sent4: His approach literalized the concept of time, viewing it as a linear progression.
meanings.sent5: The detective literalized the clues, piecing together the truth behind the crime.
